title: Need help to start out on ranked..

replies.body:
Ideally you want someone easy to play. Imo, the easiest champs are ones that don't need great mechanics to play (little or no skill shots), have great escapes, or are still effective when built tanky.

Top - {{champion:120}} Decent sustain and can escape bad situations. Also going tanky is decent so you can survive lane and fights.
Mid - {{champion:103}} Long range spells. Ulti can get you out of bad spots/ganks. But difficult to master because of her skillshots.
Jg - {{champion:5}} Super easy to play. No skill shots. Go tanky and you can survive fights.
ADC - {{champion:236}} Has a dash to escape. Decent range on ulti. His passive makes cs'ing slightly easier.
Support - {{champion:25}} Super safe champ. Her Q is low risk, high reward.

Since its tank meta, I suggest to find someone with tank. Like Alistar {{champion:12}}  as a support, I main Ahri {{champion:103}} , she has great mobility so if you are ever in a sticky situation just ult yourself out, also very good to take risks with. When you look at jungle champions you want someone who has great map control and can travel around the map to get to places quickly, but also have great ganks, Rek'Sai's {{champion:421}}  is perfect for all of these things. Hecarium {{champion:120}}  can be such a brutal top laner and he can initiate and leave team fights early and late game. Ranked isn't all about getting fed or getting the most kills, its about joining with your team and wining! Ranked will monitor your safety so be sure to ward {{item:3340}} and buy other wards too {{item:2044}} {{item:2043}} ! Yasuo {{champion:157}}  has such a difficult job, especially mid, if you screw up your early game you have screwed up. If you succeed in your early game, you will see yourself winning team fights and winning the game over all! Remember that your main goal is to win, so don't ignore your team and go for a free kill that could be an extreme bait, you must assist your team to victory

Yasuo is a tough champ tbh. i hear it takes skill to play him. I myself have thought that im an average player, but i learn very quickly in video games so he wasn't too bad to learn. I play hecarim specifically because team fighting with him is fun. He has the best tactic, charge in, spin blade, lifesteal, charge the survivors. Very fun.

1. Focus on 1 role. Its good to be able to play multiple, but its best to have a "main" and 1 or 2 champions you are really really good at.
2. Farming is super important. Focus on farming in lane before anything else.
3. Make sure not to over chase for kills. Get towers or Dragon or something when you get a kill.
4. Learn how to build and when you need to build differently.
5. Have Fun.
6. Support TF.... really? LOL

First and foremost.

Don't go into ranked with your builds, learn what actual builds work before you play this game in ranked.

Examples:
Fiddlesticks and WoTA, the item is subpar on him
Ahri with Nashor's and Statikk Shiv

Next learn how to not die, a lot of your games you have more deaths then Kills (KDA over the last 20:  6.9 / 7.8 / 9.2 )

And a note, if you do ranked any time soon, you are likely to end up between Bronze 3 and Silver 5, because that's about where your playing normals at.

Okay, well for starters, thanks for looking at my match history. It's probably a joke to experience players.
There have been games where i joked and went AD ahri (humorous when with a friend i play) but i do know not too, at least when i try. With fiddlesticks, i am still trying to learn his basics, his build etc. Likewise i have a silver 2 friend who tries to help me with this stuff, try to teach me. 

In my two (now three) games i've played, i do blame my inexperience to ranked competition towards my death count, but then again, i was playing Blitzcrank (shouldnt really be dying lol). I'm really just looking to get into more levels of competition without the gameplay in normal's being far too laid back.

Feed 2 kills every lane and you can get to bronze 5 easy.

Kill opponents twice in every lane and you will win games easily and jump your division.

Do not listen to anyones suggestions on champions to play, play who ever you enjoy the most, other wise ranked will quickly bore you. In low elo's(anything below plat) champion selection has a miniscule influence on the game. You have most likely seen players playjng very non meta champions in weird positions(zac support etc) and still winning games. I remember i only played 2 champions no matter what position i was playing, nidalee and ezreal, and this was back when no one else was playing them, and i would constantly get flamed for picking nidalee mid, and now im diamond, and i still play champions i enjoy(lee sin, wukong, lulu support) over what are considered as the strongest champions(gragas, reksai, janna). If you can play them well and enjoy playing them, it really doesnt matter.

The list you have there is pretty solid.

The ones i would recommend cutting are {{champion:4}} (I dont see support tf having any merit at all honestly), {{champion:67}} (hard to play well), {{champion:26}} (pretty weak, requires decent teammates to properly make use of the ult) and {{champion:35}} /{{champion:9}} (not bad, but require quite unique playstyles to play effectively (people playing shaco or fid in higher elo usually ONLY play that champion) so experience on them wont transfer to other champions as much)

Sticking with the simpler champs will mean you can focus on improving more general things (decision making, map movements, last hitting etc.) without having to constantly think about executing tough combos/mechanics properly or having good decisions negated by bad mechanics. Also don't worry about trying to counterpick or get OP champions, sticking with what your already know will usually be much more effective even in tough matchups. An average champ played at 90% of their potential is better than a strong champ played at 50% of their potential
